content.description: Route starts at the SW base of the Large Ear. A short and easy chimney leads to a mantle on the right. The route scrambles along the top of the feature to an overhung mantle followed by a small crevasse that can be reached across. Summit has a cairn that is visible from the approach.I did it as a roped solo and it took the entire rope (60m). Moving about on the summit is comfortable without being tied in.
content.protection: Double cams from .75 to 5. Pro was nice to have on the mantles, rather unnecessary on the rest.
content.location: From the mountain goat infested ridgeline just to the west, follow the goat trails towards the ear, as far to the north as possible. Route starts on the furthest north, easily acessible chimney.

content.description: Rabbit Ears is the two pronged prominence on the High Rim visible from the south in Logan Valley. The stone is a soft tephra that doesnt take small pro, but is very grippy. Generally the saddle between the ears is reached as a part of the High Rim hike. The large ear can be climbed from the SW face, but probably also from all sides.
